大唐三藏義淨奉　制譯
translation: translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Jīvaka of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 爾時佛告大王：「當於爾時，散彈長者於十二年飢儉亢旱供養千聖獨覺，于時帝釋助作功德，來降大雨者，大王！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the great king, At the time, the elder Saṃdhara had been starving and drought-stricken for 12 years to support a thousand noble pratyekabuddhas, and it was then that Indra assisted him in performing meritorious duties and rained down a great deal of rain, Great king!

source_sentence: 莫作異見，其散彈長者，即我身是。
translation: Don't make a different view, for that scattered elder is me.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 我於過去，非唯以此布施而證菩提。
translation: In the past, I didn't realize enlightenment just because of this generosity.

source_sentence: 勿作異見，由我正信，善根積集善根功德因緣故，更修無量福業，而證無上菩提。」
translation: Don't make different views; it's because of my right faith that the good roots accumulate the causes and conditions for the merit of the good roots, cultivate measureless meritorious actions, and realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 馬王仙作證，　　蛇命鳥王恩，
translation: The king of horses and holy ones are witnesses, while the snake-living bird king is grateful.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡尾提訶，　　龜蘇二商主。
translation: A parrot with a 尾提訶 and a tortoise are the two merchant lords.

source_sentence: 攝頌曰：佛言：「復次大王！
translation: The gathering verse said, The Buddha said, Furthermore, Great king!

source_sentence: 我求無上菩提故，利益攝受一切有情。
translation: Because I seek unsurpassed enlightenment, I benefit and take care of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Great king, listen closely!

source_sentence: 於《中阿笈摩．僧祇得分藥叉經》中廣說。
translation: It's explained in detail in the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-saṃghâvaśeṣa-sūtra.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，作一馬王，名婆羅訶，而為利益化諸有情。
translation: At the time, I became a horse king named Bālāha for the benefit of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 我求無上菩提故，攝受利益有情之事。
translation: Because I seek unsurpassed enlightenment, I take care of the welfare of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Great king, listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃至古昔，於婆羅痆斯，去城不遠有仙人住，心行慈愍悲念有情。
translation: It goes so far as to say that in ancient times there was a holy man living in Vārāṇasī not far from the city. He practiced loving-kindness toward sentient beings and had compassion for them.

source_sentence: 去彼不遠有二農夫，耕墾種植遂共相爭，互為瞋鬪遂即相打。
translation: Not far from them, there were two farmers who cultivated the land and fought over each other. They became angry with each other and struck one another.

source_sentence: 俱到仙所，並請為證，一人即往王邊，以事白王。
translation: They all went to the ṛṣi's place and asked him to testify, and one of them went to the king's side and told him about his affairs.

source_sentence: 王即告曰：『汝等相爭，何人證見？』
translation: The king then told them, 'You're fighting each other; who will witness it?'

source_sentence: 白言：『大王！
translation: They said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我等二人爭，是誰先過？』
translation: We're both fighting, so who was the first to fail?'

source_sentence: 仙人答：『若依轉輪王法，我為作證；
translation: The holy man answered, “If you rely on the teaching of the universal ruler, I will realize it for you.

source_sentence: 若行別法，我不為證。』
translation: If I practice a different teaching, I won't realize it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『如是。』
translation: The king said, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 仙人答曰：『此人瞋彼，彼人瞋此。
translation: The sage answered, 'This person is angry with that person, and that person is angry with this person.

source_sentence: 彼既打此，此還打彼。』
translation: Since they've beaten me here, I'll beat them here again.'

source_sentence: 王言：『若如是者，二俱合罰。』
translation: The king said, 'If that's the case, they'll both be punished.'

source_sentence: 仙人曰：『我先有言：「若依轉輪王法斷事，我以為證；
translation: The holy man said, “I formerly said that if one were to rely upon the teaching of the universal ruler (cakravartin), I would be able to realize it.

source_sentence: 汝若不依，我不為證。」』
translation: If you don't rely on it, I won't realize it.'

source_sentence: 時王白言：『大仙！
translation: The king then said, 'Great sage!

source_sentence: 云何作轉輪王法而斷事耶？』
translation: How does he do the work of turning the wheel of the king's teaching and stopping things?'

source_sentence: 仙人答曰：『大王！
translation: The sage answered, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 若轉輪王法，除無益事，令住有益。』
translation: If the wheel-turning king's teaching is to remove useless things and make them abide, it's beneficial.'

source_sentence: 其王告二人曰：『汝去！
translation: The king told the two men, 'Go away!'

source_sentence: 更勿如是。』」
translation: Don't do so.'

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時仙人以法作證者，勿作異見，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, At the time, the sage realized it with the Dharma and didn't give a different view, which is that I am myself.

source_sentence: 我於過去，雖作證見，依法為證，作真實證。
translation: In the past, even though I made a vision of realization, I realized it based on the Dharma as my realization and realized it in truth.

source_sentence: 由彼因緣，積集善根政信故，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of their causes and conditions, they accumulate good roots and cultivate faith, and they realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 又為求無上菩提故，攝受有情。
translation: It's also for the sake of seeking unsurpassed enlightenment that they take in sentient beings.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時在不定聚，捨自身命，饒益一切有情。
translation: At the time, the bodhisattva was in an indeterminate group, abandoning his own life and benefiting all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方處大叢林中，有師子王於中居止。
translation: In the distant past, there was a lion king living in a great jungle in one place.

source_sentence: 復有五百商人經過險路，由語聲故，有大蟒蛇驚動睡覺，五百商人悉被蟒蛇圍遶。
translation: Again, there were five hundred merchants on a dangerous path. Because of the sound of their words, a large snake in distress awoke and flew to sleep. The five hundred merchants were all surrounded by these snakes.

source_sentence: 爾時商人甚大驚怕，發聲號叫求諸天神。
translation: The merchants were greatly frightened and cried out in fear to the gods.

source_sentence: 其師子王聞此叫聲來至，乃見蟒蛇圍彼商人。
translation: When the lion king heard the sound of this screaming, he saw a snake surrounded the merchant.

source_sentence: 去此不遠有少年象，爾時師子即往象邊告言：『此諸商人今被蟒蛇圍遶欲食，汝能捨命救彼商人耶？』
translation: Not far from here, there was a young elephant, and the lion then went to the elephant's side and told him, 'Now that these merchants are surrounded by a snake and want to eat, can you give up your life to save those merchants?'

source_sentence: 其象答曰：『欲遣如何？』
translation: The elephant answered, 'What do you want to send?'

source_sentence: 師子答曰：『我須上汝頭上，後脚捉頭，以我雙爪打彼蛇腦。
translation: The lion answered, 'I must go up on top of your head, grasp it with my rear feet, and strike the snake's head with my two paws.

source_sentence: 後之兩足入汝頭中，汝當必死；
translation: The next two legs will enter your hair, and you will surely die.

source_sentence: 我打蛇腦，蛇當定死；
translation: If I strike the snake on its head, it will surely die.

source_sentence: 其蛇口吐毒氣，我亦應死。』
translation: If that snake spits out poisonous breath in my mouth, I'll die, too.'

source_sentence: 象曰：『且為利益拔濟多人，寧顧身命？』
translation: The elephant said, 'Is it for the sake of benefiting and liberating many people who would rather look after their lives?'

source_sentence: 時師子王昇象頭上，擲身打彼蟒蛇。
translation: The king of lions then ascended to the top of the elephant's head, tossed his body, and struck the snake.

source_sentence: 師子按足，象便命過；
translation: The lion pressed his feet, and the elephant’s life came to an end.

source_sentence: 打彼蟒蛇，蛇亦即死；
translation: He struck the snake, and it died as well.

source_sentence: 由蛇毒氣，師子身亡。
translation: Because of the poisonous odor of the snake, the lion died.

source_sentence: 三箇一時並皆捨報，諸商人等遂全身命。
translation: Three times, they all abandoned their rewards at once, and the merchants and others ended up with their whole lives.

source_sentence: 商人欲發，空中諸天告商人曰：『此師子王是賢劫菩薩，今為汝等捨自身命拔救諸人。
translation: When the merchants were about to leave, the gods in the sky told the merchants, 'This lion king is the bodhisattva of the good eon, and now I'll give up my life for you to rescue them.

source_sentence: 汝等宜應供養菩薩，然後進發。』
translation: It's appropriate for you to make offerings to the bodhisattva and then advance.'

source_sentence: 時諸商人即以種種供具供養師子王身，遶已而去。」
translation: The merchants then offered various offerings to the lion king's body, circled it, and departed.

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時師子王者，勿作異觀，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, Don't make any strange observations about the lion king at that time, for it was me.

source_sentence: 我於爾時在傍生趣，能救五百商人，捨自身命，害彼毒蛇。
translation: At the time, I was on the edge of rebirth, able to rescue five hundred merchants who abandoned their lives and harmed those vipers.

source_sentence: 由我慈心攝受有情，功德因緣，積集善根，正信力故，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of my compassionate mind taking in sentient beings, virtuous causes and conditions, accumulating good roots, and the power of right faith, I'll realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方處有好叢林。
translation: In the distant past, there was a good jungle in one place.

source_sentence: 然有菩薩在不定聚傍生之中作共命鳥，一身兩頭：一名達摩、二名阿達摩。
translation: Still, there's a bodhisattva who creates a bird of common life among the indeterminate groups of animals with one body and two heads: one named Dharma and two named adama.

source_sentence: 是時達摩食好甘菓，後時阿達摩便食毒果，兩俱悶亂，共相平論。
translation: At the time, Dharma ate good sweet fruit, and later, when he ate poisonous fruit, they both were in distress and argued with each other.

source_sentence: 一作邪願：『願我所生之處，常共汝為惡友，能為損害。』
translation: One is to make a mistaken vow, 'May I always be with you as a bad friend where I'm born and be able to harm you.'

source_sentence: 二者發願：『願我生生之處，常行慈心，利益汝身。』」
translation: Second, he gives rise to the vow, 'May I always practice compassion where I'm born and benefit your body.'

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「於汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the great king, What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時名達摩者，即我身是。
translation: At the time, that person named Dharma was me.

source_sentence: 其名阿達摩者，即提婆達多是。
translation: The name adaman refers to Devadatta.

source_sentence: 我為慈悲心故，由彼因緣，積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of my compassion, I'll realize unsurpassed enlightenment because of their causes and conditions and accumulate good roots.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方處有好流池。
translation: In ancient times there was a pond of good flowing water in one place.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時於不定聚作其鳥身，於五百鳥中而為鳥王。
translation: At the time, the bodhisattva made a bird's body in an indeterminate group of birds and became the king of the five hundred birds.

source_sentence: 其中有一老鳥，不能遠求食飲，常食小鳥及諸鳥卵，徐劣而行，既食飽已一足而立。
translation: There was an old bird among them that couldn't go far to solicit food and drink, always feeding on small birds and the eggs of other birds, traveled slowly and slowly, and stood up one leg after being fed.

source_sentence: 時諸小鳥，常被食噉，心大愁苦，共詣王邊，作鳥語聲，白言：『鳥王！
translation: The small birds then, always eaten and tormented, became greatly distressed and went to the king's side, made a bird-talking sound, saying, 'Bird King!

source_sentence: 具說如前，愁悲苦惱。』
translation: I'll explain it as before, grieving and suffering.'

source_sentence: 鳥王即為尋訪斯事，是誰食噉諸鳥子等？
translation: The king of birds then wanted to investigate this matter, so who was it that ate the tiny birds and so forth?

source_sentence: 菩薩雖在惡趣心常無異，如是訪察，乃見老鳥詐劣徐行，在池岸邊翹足而立。
translation: Although the bodhisattva was in a bad destiny, his mind always remained unchanging, and when he thus inspected it, he saw an old bird deceitfully walking slowly at the edge of the pond, standing with legs crossed.

source_sentence: 「『食噉諸鳥卵，　　并餘小鳥等；
translation: 'Eat the gnats, eggs, and other small birds.

source_sentence: 翹足一脚立，　　猶如持戒者。
translation: He stands with one leg on his feet, just like a person who observes the precepts.

source_sentence: 徐徐而縮脚，　　微劣詐言談；
translation: They walk slowly, shrinking their legs, Weakening in speech and deceit.

source_sentence: 曲項嬌為斯，　　必是多姦詐。』
translation: Such a crooked neck is certainly adulterous and fraudulent.'

source_sentence: 于時鳥王菩薩即便覺知是損害之者，而說頌曰：「爾時老鳥便作是念：『今者鳥王既察知我，我今歸依。』
translation: Knowing that this was a harmful thing, the bird king bodhisattva then said in verse, The old bird then thought, 'Now that the bird king has known me, I'll take refuge now.'

source_sentence: 鳥王告曰：『汝可設計，勿令諸鳥知汝怨事。』
translation: The king of birds told him, 'You may designate yourself so that the birds won't know about your enemies.'

source_sentence: 老鳥聞已速即逃去。
translation: When the old bird heard this, it quickly fled.

source_sentence: 于時眾鳥安隱無憂。」
translation: The birds at the time were peaceful and without sorrow.

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時鳥王者，莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, At the time, that bird king, don't make any different views, for it was me.

source_sentence: 我為鳥王之時，由能慈攝一切有情。
translation: When I'm the king of birds, it's because I can compassionately take care of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 由彼因緣，積集善根正見力故，證得無上正等菩提。
translation: Because of their causes and conditions, they accumulate the roots of goodness and because of the power of right view, they realize unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方所叢林之中，菩薩爾時在不定聚作鸚鵡鳥，常解人語。
translation: In the distant past, in a jungle in one direction, the bodhisattva was at that time standing in an indeterminate group of people like a parrot and always understanding human speech.

source_sentence: 然於彼時，婆羅痆斯有王名曰梵德，正紹王位，以法化世。
translation: At the time, however, there was a king named Brahmadeva in Vārāṇasī who correctly assumed the throne and transformed the world with the Dharma.

source_sentence: 而有一鳥欲害鸚鵡，鸚鵡飛投大王手中，告言：『大王！
translation: A bird wanted to harm a parrot, and the parrot flew into the king's hand and told him, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 莫非法化世。』
translation: Don't teach the world unlawfully.'

source_sentence: 時王見鳥來投手中，心生憐念，即於鸚鵡邊而受五戒，以法化世，勅群臣曰：『今於一切鳥獸，以無畏施。』」
translation: Seeing the bird in his hand, the king felt pity for it and accepted the five precepts by the side of a parrot, transformed the world with the Dharma, and instructed his ministers, 'Now, I'll give fearlessly to all birds and animals.'

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「莫作異見。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, Don't make a different view.

source_sentence: 爾時鸚鵡，解為人語者，見善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: At the time, the parrot understood it to be human speech because he saw the good roots and realized unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於婆羅痆斯有梵德王，正紹王位。
translation: Formerly there was a brahmin king in Vārāṇasī, who assumed the throne of king.

source_sentence: 去此不遠，有尾提訶國起逆，其梵德王常欲伐彼不臣。
translation: Not far from here a rebellion occurred in the country of Videha, and King Brahmadeva always wanted to suppress that non-subject.

source_sentence: 其梵德王兵眾強盛，其尾提訶國雖兵馬驅勝，而常心行慈悲於梵德王。
translation: The king of Brahmā's army was strong, and although his country of Videha was victorious in terms of troops and horses, he always practiced compassion toward the king of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 其梵德王貪愛其國，興舉四兵往擊尾提訶國。
translation: Because King Brahmadeva desired his kingdom, he raised four armies and went to attack the country of Videha.

source_sentence: 其王聞梵德王四兵欲來，即令掃灑城邑無諸瓦石，懸繒幡花，辨諸飲食。
translation: When the king heard that the four armies of King Brahmadeva were about to come, he ordered them to sweep the city without any stones or tiles, hang silhouettering banners and flowers, and identify the food and drink.

source_sentence: 又勅諸臣等，令城內人民出城預前二十五里，香花迎接，復作百種言詞，讚美王德。
translation: I also ordered my officials and others to allow the citizens of the city to leave the city twenty-five li in front of me. To greet me with fragrant flowers, they uttered a hundred other kinds of words praising the king’s virtue.

source_sentence: 其梵德王聞此事已，瞋心乃息，便作是念：『既逆善言，不相違逆，今可迴軍。』
translation: After hearing this, the king of Brahmadeva stopped his anger and thought, 'Since you're going against good words and aren't going against each other, now you can turn your army back.'

source_sentence: 時尾提訶國群臣等讚梵德王曰：『願王過國，所有軍眾，廣陳設會。』
translation: The ministers of Vaideha then praised King Brahmadeva, saying, 'May the king go beyond his country, and all the armies and troops he has have will be presented in detail for assembly.'

source_sentence: 「『大王受懺摩，　　我當親奉敬；
translation: 'When the great king receives a repentance, I will personally venerate it.

source_sentence: 諸事隨王作，　　幸賜為親友。』
translation: All things are done according to the king's work, and it's fortunate that they're given to a friend.'

source_sentence: 「『由忍得解脫，　　瞋心寂無起；
translation: 'It's because of forbearance that they attain liberation, and their anger is silenced without arising.

source_sentence: 為一切能故，　　能勝一切人。』
translation: Because of all their abilities, they're able to overcome all people.'

source_sentence: 尾提訶王說伽他曰：「爾時梵德王復以伽他答曰：「爾時二王共為和合，其梵德王即歸本國，尾提訶國一切人民皆悉無畏。」
translation: The king of Videha said to Kṣāṭa, At the time, King Brahmadeva again answered with a reply in verse, At the time, the two kings were united, and that king Brahmā returned to his own country, and all the people of Videha had no fear.

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時尾提國王者，莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, Don't make any different views about the king of Wendi at that time, for it was me.

source_sentence: 我為調伏其心，由彼積集正信善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: In order to tame their minds, I'll cultivate the good roots of right faith because they accumulate them and realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，菩薩爾時在不定聚，於大海中作一龜王。
translation: Ancient times long ago, when the Bodhisattva was in an indeterminate group of people, he became a turtle king in the ocean.

source_sentence: 復於後時，有五百商人乘船入海，乃被海獸打破船舶。
translation: Later, another five hundred merchants boarded the ship and went into the sea, but they were sunk by a sea creature.

source_sentence: 其龜取五百商人置於背上，渡出海中。
translation: The turtle took the five hundred merchants, placed them on its back, and crossed out into the ocean.

source_sentence: 爾時商人皆悉安隱，全其身命。」
translation: At that point, the merchants were all at peace, and their lives were complete.

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「然於彼時大龜王者，莫作異見，即我身是，為由慈攝有情，由彼因緣，正信積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, Still, don't make a different view of the great tortoise king at that time, namely, that I am myself, for the sake of compassionately taking care of sentient beings; it's because of those causes and conditions that they correctly believe in the accumulation of good roots and realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，時毘提訶國有五百群臣。
translation: In ancient times there were five hundred ministers in the kingdom of Videha.

source_sentence: 其中有二兄弟，最為大臣：兄名蘇斯那、弟名斯那。
translation: Among them, there were two brothers, the most prominent among ministers: the elder named Suna and the younger named Suna.

source_sentence: 其名斯那者，心常好覓人過，無利益心。
translation: His name wassena, and his mind always liked to look for faults in people but didn't have the intention to benefit them.

source_sentence: 其蘇斯那者，於一切時常行利益。
translation: That susena always acts for the benefit of all people at all times.

source_sentence: 為由蘇斯那常行利益故，其斯那既無利益，惱亂人民，城中眾俱來白王，說彼所作無利益事。
translation: Because it's for the benefit of Susena that he always conducts himself, his lack of benefit disturbs the people. All the people in the city come to the king and tell him about the lack of benefit they're doing.

source_sentence: 其王即令擯出境外，便往婆羅痆斯城，事梵德王。
translation: The king then ordered Kauṇḍinya to leave the country and went to the city of Vārāṇasī, where he served King Brahmadeva.

source_sentence: 後於異時，其蘇斯那聞弟被擯出境，在婆羅痆斯梵德王所以為臣佐，即白毘提訶王言：『今欲往彼婆羅痆斯看弟，作其和順之事。』
translation: Later, at another time, his younger brother Suna heard that he had been expelled from the boundary and was assisted by King Brahmadeva in Vārāṇasī, so he said to King Vaideha, 'Now, I want to go to that brahmin in Vārāṇasī to look after my younger brother and do something harmonious for him.'

source_sentence: 城中人眾皆生怪愕：『其弟常於兄處作無益事。
translation: The people in the city all wondered, 'That younger brother always did useless things at his brother's place.

source_sentence: 其弟王擯出國境，此兄尚於弟處能行饒益，共為和可。』」
translation: The king's younger brother is out of the country, but this brother can still work to benefit his younger brother and make a peaceful settlement together.'

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「莫作異見，於彼時中，名蘇斯那大臣者，即我身是，常為利益有情。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, Don't make any different views; during that time, he was called Minister Susena, which is self and always for the benefit of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 由彼因緣，正信積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, they correctly believe in the accumulation of good roots and realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔於一方所，有一大城。
translation: In the distant past, there was a great city in one direction.

source_sentence: 其城中有二商人居止，將五百乘車載其寶貨，行至曠野險路，具如《中阿笈摩》說。
translation: In that city, there were two merchants living in it, carrying their treasured goods in five hundred carriages and traveling to the dangerous path of the wilderness, as described in the Middle Lengths of the Abhidharma.

source_sentence: 其一商人，已被藥叉噉食。
translation: One of those merchants had already been eaten by the yakṣa.

source_sentence: 第二商主，平安得出曠野之中。」
translation: The second merchant lord, he'll be able to safely escape into the wilderness.

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「其第二商主，平安得出曠野之嶮者，莫作異觀，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, The second merchant lord, who can safely escape the  precipitous paths of the wilderness, don't look differently; it's me.

source_sentence: 為慈攝有情，由彼因緣，正信積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: In order to compassionately gather sentient beings, it's because of their causes and conditions that they correctly believe in the accumulation of good roots and realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方所叢林之中，多饒河澗，花菓滋茂。
translation: Formerly, in the distant past, there was a forest in one part of the empire where there were many rivers and streams with abundant flowers and fruit.

source_sentence: 爾時菩薩在不定聚，作六牙象王，在其林內。
translation: At the time, the bodhisattva was in an indeterminate group of elephants and became a six-tusked elephant king inside that forest.

source_sentence: 其象王妻名曰拔陀，於母象中為最尊貴。
translation: The wife of the elephant king was named Bhadra, the most honored among his mothers.

source_sentence: 是時象王出群，在於閑僻之處，有別雌象，端正悅意，詣象王處，共為私竊。
translation: At that time the elephant king was out of the herd and stayed in a secluded place. A separate female elephant, graceful and delighted, approached the elephant king’s place to privately steal his property.

source_sentence: 既為夫婦，甚加憐愛，行住相隨，意不相離，心相繫著。
translation: Since they were husband and wife, they had great affection for each other, followed each other in their movements and abodes, didn't part from each other in mind, and were bound by each other in mind.

source_sentence: 時拔陀母象，便生嫉妬，即自思念：『作何方計，便我當得殺六牙象王并彼母象？』
translation: The mother elephant of Bhada then became jealous and thought to herself, 'What's the way to calculate it so that I can kill the six-tusked elephant king and his mother elephant?'

source_sentence: 正住思惟，心大嫉妬，無計可得，遂便發願：『願我生生之處，能害二人。』
translation: When he correctly abides in contemplation, his mind becomes greatly jealous and unfathomable, so he then makes the vow, 'May I be born where I can harm two people.'

source_sentence: 作是願已，於山頂上投身而下，便即命終，生毘提國大夫人腹，而處其胎。
translation: Having made this vow, he prostrated himself at the top of the mountain and descended downward. Soon after his life ended, he was born in the womb of the great queen of Videha.

source_sentence: 十月滿已誕生一女，眾相具足，漸漸長大，嫁與隣國梵德大王為第一夫人。
translation: When the tenth month was over she gave birth to a daughter, endowed with all the marks of greatness and gradually growing in stature. She married brahmin king Brahmā of a neighboring country as her first wife.

source_sentence: 由彼宿業，於六牙象等生大瞋恨，然而夫人有宿命智，即白梵德王言：『於彼方所，有六牙大象，我今要此象牙，願王令取。』
translation: Because of their past actions, they became greatly angry with the six-tusked elephant and so forth, but the lady had knowledge of past lives and said to King Brahmadeva, 'There's a six-tusked elephant in that place; now I want this elephant teeth, may the king take them.'

source_sentence: 于時王勅諸城所有獵師皆悉喚集，令取六牙大象。
translation: The king then ordered all the hunters in the cities to call assemblies and cause them to take the six-tusked great elephant.

source_sentence: 獵師集已，告曰：『汝等往取象牙將來。』
translation: After the hunter had assembled, he told them, 'Go and fetch the ivory in the near future.'

source_sentence: 時諸獵師，王既勅已，依命即去。
translation: The hunters then ordered the king to follow their orders and departed.

source_sentence: 其獵師大將告獵人曰：『汝等並散，各歸本業，我獨自往取其象牙。』
translation: The hunter general told the hunter, 'You've all scattered away, each returning to their original business, and I'll go alone to get the elephant's tusks.'

source_sentence: 是時大將即取祭祀之物，并著衣甲毒箭等物，造詣方所。
translation: The general then took the things for the sacrifice, put on his robes, armor, poisonous arrows, and other things, and went to the monastery.

source_sentence: 見彼象王并及母象，二俱別住於閑靜處，各離象群而住，見已遠至遙望。
translation: He saw that the king elephant and his mother elephant were living separately in a secluded place, each apart from the herd of elephants. Having seen them, he went far away to look out into the distance.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師身被忍服，覆其弓箭，所有衣甲藏在草中，欲為殺害。
translation: It was then that the hunter's body was covered with tolerance, covered by his bow and arrow, stored in the grass with his clothes and armor, and intended to kill him.

source_sentence: 爾時母象遙見獵師，即告夫曰：『我等速向餘處，今有人來欲殺我等。』
translation: It was then that the mother elephant saw the hunter from a distance and told her husband, 'Let's quickly go to another place; now someone has come here who wants to kill us.'

source_sentence: 象王曰：『其人作何形貌？』
translation: The elephant king said, 'What's the shape of that man?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『身被忍衣，外現慈相。』
translation: He answered, 'My body is covered with the robe of forbearance, and outwardly I show compassion.'

source_sentence: 『若如是者，當須無畏。
translation: 'If you do so, you must have no fear.

source_sentence: 在袈裟中，無不善事。
translation: There's nothing unwholesome about being in a monk's robe.

source_sentence: 此之幢相覆蓋之人，心住慈悲，當須無怖，勿生疑惑。
translation: The person covered with the marks of this banner, whose mind is based on kindness and pity, must be fearless and not have doubts or doubts.

source_sentence: 如月無熱，斯人亦如是。』
translation: Like the moon without heat, so is this person.'

source_sentence: 于時母象及以象王，並無疑惑，隨意遊行。
translation: The mother elephant and the king of the elephants then traveled as they wished without doubt.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師既得其便，即放毒箭，射彼象王，中於要處。
translation: When the hunter got an advantage over him, he released a poisonous arrow and shot the elephant king, who was in the middle of the important place.

source_sentence: 母象告曰：『如何乃言著袈裟人無有害心？』
translation: The mother elephant told him, 'How can you say that someone wearing a monk's robe has no harmful thoughts?'

source_sentence: 「『心非生過患，　　亦非衣所作；
translation: 'The mind isn't produced by faults or distress, Nor is it made by clothing.

source_sentence: 此過由煩惱，　　由心離慈愍。
translation: This fault is due to defilement, Because the mind is free from loving kindness and pity.

source_sentence: 如金裹銅葉，　　入火銅性現；
translation: It is like a sheet of copper wrapped in gold, Entering into the fire and manifesting as copper.

source_sentence: 患人雖不了，　　智者善能知。
translation: Even though the afflicted person doesn't understand it, the wise can well know it.

source_sentence: 弓箭人俱毒，　　咸由彼為惡；
translation: A bow, an arrow, and a man are all poisonous, All because of that which is evil.

source_sentence: 袈裟本寂靜，　　皆悉由心作。』
translation: The robes are originally quiescent, and they're all made by the mind.'

source_sentence: 「『我不違君語，　　如君今所說；
translation: 'I won't disobey your words, just as you have now explained.

source_sentence: 我欲碎斯人，　　節節令其斷。』
translation: I want to crush this person, and I'll cause him to stop it every season.'

source_sentence: 爾時象王以頌答曰：「爾時母象心生瞋恚，告其夫曰：「是時象王聞此語已，生如是念：『作何醫療此煩惱事？
translation: The king of elephants then replied in verse, At that point, the mother elephant became angry and told her husband, After hearing these words, the king of elephants had this thought, 'What's the way to treat this affliction?'

source_sentence: 若是菩薩婦起怨害心者，此不應也。』
translation: If a bodhisattva's wife gives rise to hostile thoughts, this shouldn't be the case.'

source_sentence: 「『如被多鬼所著心，　　見醫即作非供養；
translation: 'It's like being attached to the mind of many ghosts, Seeing a doctor and then making an offering that's not an offering.

source_sentence: 醫人見彼常非恨，　　應生如是歡喜心。』
translation: Seeing that they're always not hateful, the doctor should give rise to this kind of joyous mind.'

source_sentence: 說伽他曰：「爾時母象聞其菩薩象王所說，默然而住。
translation: He said to the gandharva, It was then that the mother elephant heard what the bodhisattva elephant king said and remained silent.

source_sentence: 時諸群象詣象王處，便作是念：『勿此母象損害獵師。』
translation: The herd of elephants then went to the elephant king's place and thought, 'Don't let this mother elephant harm the hunter.'

source_sentence: 若菩薩在傍生趣中，常行菩薩行。
translation: Suppose a bodhisattva is in the path of an unenlightened person who always practices the bodhisattva's practice.

source_sentence: 是時象王往獵師邊，以人言音告獵師曰：『汝莫怪畏。』
translation: The elephant king then went to the hunter's side and addressed him in human words, 'Don't be frightened.'

source_sentence: 恐損獵師，象王以鼻遶取獵師，抱在胸前，又令母象別向餘處，然後告曰：『丈夫！
translation: Fearing to harm the hunter, the king elephant takes the hunter by the nose and puts him in front of his chest. He also lets his mother go somewhere else. Then he says:

source_sentence: 母象已去。
translation: The mother elephant has departed.

source_sentence: 汝若須我身上物者，任意取之。』
translation: If you need anything on my body, take it at will.'

source_sentence: 是時獵師心極怪愕：『此乃是人，我非人也。
translation: The hunter was then greatly surprised and startled, saying, 'This is a man; I am not a man.'

source_sentence: 我是人中象，汝是象中人。
translation: I am the elephant among men, and you are the man among elephants.

source_sentence: 汝在傍生，有是情智？
translation: You're an unenlightened person, but is there this kind of mental cognition?

source_sentence: 我居人類，反無斯慧。』
translation: I live among humans, but there's no such wisdom.'

source_sentence: 悲啼泣淚。
translation: He cried out in pity and wept.

source_sentence: 菩薩問曰：『為何啼泣？』
translation: The bodhisattva asked, 'Why are you weeping?'

source_sentence: 獵師答曰：『汝已損我。』
translation: The hunter answered, 'You've harmed me.'

source_sentence: 時象王聞已，作是思惟：『我現相救，不曾有損。』
translation: After hearing this, the elephant king thought, 'Now that I've been saved, there's no harm inflicted by anyone.'

source_sentence: 復更思惟：『不是雌象而來損耶？』
translation: Again, he thought, 'Isn't it a female elephant that comes to harm me?'

source_sentence: 又問獵師曰：『誰損汝耶？』
translation: Again, he asked the hunter, 'Who harmed you?'

source_sentence: 獵師答曰：『象王！
translation: The hunter answered, 'E象 king!

source_sentence: 汝身有無量功德，無辜加害，即是損我。
translation: Your body has immeasurable merit, and it's not blameworthy to harm it, which is to harm me.

source_sentence: 汝身被箭所傷，可有治療。
translation: Your body is injured by an arrow, so you should be treated.

source_sentence: 我心被射，愚癡無智，難可療治。』
translation: My mind is being shot, and I'm foolish and lacking wisdom, which is difficult to treat.'

source_sentence: 「『我今觀察象王行，　　功德廣大猶如海；
translation: 'Now, I'll observe the elephant king's conduct, whose virtue is as vast as an ocean.

source_sentence: 起害之人猶發慈，　　此之菩薩心難得。
translation: A person who gives rise to harm is still compassionate, but this is a bodhisattva whose mind is difficult to attain.

source_sentence: 假說我今身是人，　　了無如是真智覺；
translation: Suppose you say that I am now a human being, Realizing that there is no such awakening of true knowledge.

source_sentence: 但有如斯瞋害毒，　　身空無有少功德。
translation: But there's such a poison of anger and harmfulness, and the body is empty without little merit.

source_sentence: 莊嚴形貌似人身，　　不如生在傍生趣；
translation: Their adorned form resembles a human body, Unlike beings born in the realm of the unenlightened.

source_sentence: 汝在傍生有人智，　　象王為最象中尊。
translation: You're a man of intelligence who lives on the sidelines, and the king of elephants is the most honored among elephants.

source_sentence: 不言形貌即成人，　　不以傍生非是人；
translation: They don’t say form is adulthood, And they don’t think of unenlightened people as nonhumans.

source_sentence: 若有人慈功德者，　　彼乃當知即是人。』
translation: If someone has the merit of kindness, they'll know that they're a human being.'

source_sentence: 而說頌曰：「爾時象王告曰：『不勞廣說多言語，不用多述巧言辭。
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, At the time, the elephant king told him, 'There's no need to speak extensively and often; there's no need to speak eloquently and skillfully.

source_sentence: 汝今云何箭射我？
translation: How did you shoot me with an arrow?

source_sentence: 速說斯事令我知。』
translation: Quickly explain these things so that I'll know them.'

source_sentence: 獵師答曰：『我奉王教，須汝身牙，緣此射之。』
translation: The hunter answered, 'I'll follow the king's teaching and need your body and teeth to shoot them for this reason.'

source_sentence: 象王告曰：『仁所須者，幸時早取。
translation: The elephant king told him, 'Sir, please take what you need at an early hour.'

source_sentence: 菩薩為懷，無不捨者，任汝拔牙，將所利益。』
translation: For the sake of the bodhisattva's heart, there's nothing that he won't abandon, so let's you remove your teeth and benefit them.'

source_sentence: 「『利益一切有情等，　　速離漂流生死海；
translation: To benefit all sentient beings and so forth, they quickly part with the sea of birth and death.

source_sentence: 常證無上菩提智，　　唯願早入涅槃城。』
translation: I'll always realize the unsurpassed wisdom of enlightenment, so may I enter the city of nirvāṇa soon.'

source_sentence: 說伽陀曰：「爾時獵師心生羞恥，告象王曰：『我須汝牙。』
translation: He said to Gadha, At the time, the hunter became ashamed and told the elephant king, 'I need your tooth relic.'

source_sentence: 象王告曰：『任意拔將。』
translation: The elephant king told him, 'I'll freely remove the general.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我不能拔。
translation: He replied, 'I can't pull it out.

source_sentence: 若令我拔，願住慈悲，我方能拔；
translation: If you cause me to pull out, and wish to abide in kindness and compassion, I will be able to pull it out.

source_sentence: 若其不住慈悲之心，正拔之時，手必墮落。』
translation: If he doesn't abide in the mind of compassion, his hand will surely fall off when he correctly removes it.'

source_sentence: 象王告曰：『若汝不能拔者，我自拔與。』
translation: The elephant king told him, 'If you can't pull it out, I will pull it myself.'

source_sentence: 象王曰：『為我牙根入肉深遠。』
translation: The elephant king said, 'For my sake, the tooth root enters deep into the flesh for me.'

source_sentence: 當拔之時白血流注。
translation: When he removes it, white blood flows out.

source_sentence: 拔已欲與獵師，象王身色鮮白如優曇鉢花，血流遍身，如山雪覆，亦如襇文。
translation: After pulling it out, he wanted to give it to the hunter, but the king elephant's body was as pure white as the udumbara flower, and blood flowed all over his body like a mountain covered with snow, just like the shape of a garland.

source_sentence: 「爾時象王自心覩見身相如是，恐有退轉，欲堅其心，不令嬈亂。
translation: At the time, the elephant king saw for himself that his body looked like this and was afraid he'd retreat, wanting to strengthen his mind so it wouldn't be disturbed.

source_sentence: 由彼菩薩多習性故，而行其施，豈有退邪？
translation: Is there a mistake in that bodhisattva's practice of generosity because they are often accustomed to it?

source_sentence: 至於死路，唯歸佛陀。
translation: As for the path to death, he returned only to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 於彼時中，有種種異相，為空中諸天心得滿足，便生喜悅，現希有事。
translation: At the time, there were various different signs that filled the minds of the gods in the sky with joy and gave rise to rare things.

source_sentence: 「『我等諸天見，　　象王行苦行；
translation: 'We gods see That the elephant king is engaged in ascetic practices.

source_sentence: 當正拔牙時，　　受於無量苦；
translation: When they were pulling out their teeth, They suffered immeasurable pain.

source_sentence: 內心猶喜悅，　　必不退菩提。』
translation: With joy and joy in his heart, he'll surely not regress from enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「『如此拔牙身受苦，　　云何能發趣菩提？
translation: 'Suppose someone pulls out their tooth body and suffers pain like this, so how can they aspire to enlightenment?'

source_sentence: 猶如地獄受苦人，　　必不能發慈悲意。』
translation: It's like a person suffering in hell who mustn't give rise to compassion.'

source_sentence: 然由象王作是苦行，空中有天而說頌曰：「別有一天而問彼天曰：「爾時象王拔牙已，默然而住。
translation: However, because the elephant king was engaged in such an ascetic practice, a god spoke a verse in the sky, saying, Some other god asked that god, After pulling out his tusks, the elephant king remained silent.

source_sentence: 獵師念曰：『云何拔牙，執持而住？
translation: The hunter thought, 'How do you pull out your tooth and stand holding it?'

source_sentence: 欲生悔耶？
translation: Do you want to give rise to regret?

source_sentence: 不與我耶？』
translation: Won't you give it to me?'

source_sentence: 于時象王觀知彼意，即持優曇鉢花白色六牙，引其前足，而以六牙欲捨與之，告曰：『待住少時！
translation: Knowing what he wanted, the elephant king then took the white six-tusked flower of the udumbara and said, 'Wait a little while!'

source_sentence: 待住少時！
translation: I'll wait for a little while!

source_sentence: 我今極痛。』
translation: Now, I'm in extreme pain.'

source_sentence: 象王又作此念：『受者現前，何須久住？
translation: The elephant king also thought, 'The recipient is now present, so why would it need to stay long?'

source_sentence: 如何不施？
translation: Why don't you give it?

source_sentence: 本為此牙欲殺於我，今既無牙，何慮餘事。』
translation: Formerly, he wanted to kill me for this tooth, but now that there's no tooth, why should he worry about other things?'

source_sentence: 告獵師曰：『汝應善聽。』
translation: He told the hunter, 'You should listen well.'

source_sentence: 「『賢首汝應棄惡事，　　所持利劍弓箭物；
translation: Good man, you should abandon evil deeds That you hold: The sharp sword, the bow, and the arrow.

source_sentence: 被此袈裟仁者衣，　　我今見此心歡悅。
translation: I'm wearing this monk's robe, a kind man's robe, and now that I see it, my heart is joyous.

source_sentence: 或有施淨受亦淨，　　或有施淨受不淨；

source_sentence: 「復次大王！

source_sentence: 菩薩在不定聚時，生在龍趣，名曰矚波龍子，於《龍本生經》中廣說。

translation: When the bodhisattva is in an indeterminate group, he creates the body of a king goose, as explained in detail in the Goose's Originally born Sutra.

source_sentence: 爾時勝光大王白佛言：「大德世尊！

translation: When did he first give rise to the vow for unsurpassed enlightenment?

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「乃往古昔無量劫時，有王名曰光明。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, In ancient times, there was a king named Light who lived for measureless eons.

source_sentence: 其光明王有一象寶，身色鮮白如優鉢花，七支圓滿，形貌端嚴，人所喜見。
translation: The king of that light had an elephant treasure, with a body as pure white as the white lotus blossom and seven limbs complete. It was dignified in appearance and people liked to see it.

source_sentence: 時王即勅調象之人：『令調此象，堪乘之時，將來見我。』
translation: The king then instructed the elephant tamer, 'Let's tame this elephant, and when he's capable of riding it, he'll come to see me.'

source_sentence: 其調象人受王勅已，即將調教。
translation: After the elephant tamer had received the king's command, he was about to tame it.

source_sentence: 既成就已，還詣王所。
translation: Having done so, he returned to the king’s quarters.

source_sentence: 王即乘象，并調象人，王在後坐，出城遊獵種種禽獸。
translation: The king then rode the elephant and tamed the elephant, and while the king was sitting behind him, he left the city to hunt various birds and animals.

source_sentence: 然而象王聞母象氣，尋香而走。
translation: Yet the king of elephants, hearing the smell of his mother’s elephant breath, ran away in search of her odor.

source_sentence: 「『我見虛空轉，　　四方上下迴；
translation: 'I see space revolving, Revolving in all directions up and down.

source_sentence: 山地如陶輪，　　樹亦空中去。
translation: The ground of the mountain is like a potter’s wheel, And the trees also go up into the sky.

source_sentence: 象足不曾移，　　猶如騰空去；
translation: The elephant’s feet never moved, Like rising up and going down in the sky.

source_sentence: 觀前山走來，　　後山無不動。
translation: Observing the coming and going of the former mountain, The latter doesn’t budge.

source_sentence: 須勒象令住，　　極打令其怕；
translation: The celestial elephant is made to abide, Being terrified by extreme beating.

source_sentence: 象王既未調，　　死生今在即。』
translation: Since the elephant king hasn't been disciplined, his death and birth are now here.'

source_sentence: 「『我誦大仙所說呪，　　并以鐵鉤鉤極打；
translation: 'I recite the mantra taught by the great sage, and I strike him with an iron hook.

source_sentence: 誦呪鉤打唯加急，　　所用之法皆無益。
translation: Reciting dhāraṇīs, hooks, and beating is only an added urgency, but the methods used are useless.

source_sentence: 無索無鉤能禁制，　　王知無物何能止；
translation: There was no rope or hook to restrain them, and the king knew there was nothing he could stop.

source_sentence: 貪欲入心無調者，　　欲在心中如掘釘；
translation: When craving enters the mind without regulation, Desire remains in the mind like a moat and nails.

translation: When this desire arises, it's so vast that there's no one who can stop it.'

source_sentence: 王見象走其疾如風，告象師曰：「爾時調象師白王曰：「爾時調象師作種種法，不能止息而令象迴。

source_sentence: 又白王言：『其象走困，願王攀取樹枝，放象隨意。』
translation: Again, he said to the king, 'That elephant is running in distress, so may the king take a tree branch and let it go as he wishes.'

source_sentence: 即逢一樹，王及象師攀枝而住，喻如從死而得再生。
translation: When he met a tree, the king and elephant master climbed its branches and stayed there, resembling being reborn from death.

source_sentence: 王告象師曰：『汝不調此象成就，便即將來與我乘騎。』
translation: The king told the elephant trainer, 'If you don't tame this elephant and make it complete, he'll come and ride with me.'

source_sentence: 白王曰：『我調成就，然為彼象聞雌象氣，貪欲醉故不受言教。
translation: He said to the king, 'I've accomplished my regulation, but for that elephant I hear the energy of a female elephant and don't accept its words because I'm drunk with craving.

source_sentence: 其象雖去，思憶本處，至第七日，必還來到。
translation: On the seventh day the elephant will surely come back, though it has already departed.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

translation: Seeing their mother's elephant, they shared the desire to travel together and thought of the elephant's monastery.'

source_sentence: 至第七日，其象還還來。
translation: On the seventh day, the elephant returned.

translation: The elephant tamer then quickly went to the king and told him.

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝教此象，未好成就。』
translation: The king said, 'Teach this elephant; it's not well accomplished.'

source_sentence: 其人白王：『我調象已。』
translation: The man said to the king, 'I've tamed the elephant.'

source_sentence: 責曰：『云何調伏？』
translation: He reprimanded him, saying, 'How do you subdue it?'

source_sentence: 白言：『請王驗試，即知虛實。』
translation: He said, 'Invited by the king to test him, he'll know what's true.'

translation: The tamer of the elephants immediately burned a large iron ball as red as fire and caused the elephants to take food.

translation: The elephant then went before him, intending to take food and swallow it.

translation: He instructed the elephant man again to tell the king, 'If an elephant eats it, the elephant won't live.'

translation: The king then addressed the elephant trainer, saying, 'Such-and-such discipline is confusing to me at the time.'

translation: He first said to the king, 'I simply subdued my body and couldn't tame my mind.'

translation: The king said, 'Do you see anyone who can tame your mind?'

translation: The elephant trainer said to the king, 'Yes!

source_sentence: 唯佛世尊能調身心。
translation: Only the Bhagavān can tame body and mind.

source_sentence: 一切有情欲調其心，由不能調，而皆却退。
translation: All sentient beings want to regulate their minds, but because they can't regulate it, they all retreat.

translation: There are heretics who practice asceticism but cannot get rid of the forest of craving in their minds.

source_sentence: 阿素落等，及以天人、師子雜獸、龍蛇鳩鴿，乃至飛鵝雜類等，一切含識皆被欲縛，無始已來如輪迴轉。

source_sentence: 少年容貌乃至於老，調伏其心，種種苦行，或有仙人，飡風食菓，皆不調心。
translation: Their youthful appearance and even their old age subdued their minds, and various ascetic practices sometimes led some sages to eat the wind and fruit, but they didn't tame their minds.

translation: It was then that King Vaiśravaṇa again said to the Bhagavān, Who did you first practice generosity to attain unsurpassed enlightenment?

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「乃往古昔無量劫時，有城名曰毘訶彼地，其城有一陶輪工師。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, In ancient times, there was a city named Vaiśālī, in which there was a potter-wheel smith.

source_sentence: 有佛出世，號曰釋迦牟尼，證無上正真等正覺，十號具足。
translation: There was a Buddha appearing in the world named Śākyamuni who had attained unsurpassed true perfect enlightenment and possessed the ten epithets.

source_sentence: 亦有聲聞弟子，名舍利弗、大目乾連，及侍者阿難陀。
translation: There were also śrāvaka disciples named Śāriputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, and their attendant Ānanda.

translation: Śākyamuni Buddha, the perfectly enlightened and fully awakened one, traveled among the people together with an immeasurable number of monks and went to that city.

translation: It was then that the Buddha suddenly had a windstorm and told Ānanda, 'You may go to that potter's house and beg for butter, oil, honey, and juice.'

translation: When the potter heard what Kauśinagara Ānanda said, he took some butter, oil, honey, and so forth, and the elders went with their children to the Buddha, smeared his body with such things as ghee and honey, bathed it with warm water and sugar, and presented it to the Bhagavān in order to treat illnesses that would immediately heal them.

source_sentence: 「『我以蘇蜜施如來，　　願獲廣大功德利；
translation: 'I give milk and honey to the enlightened, wishing to attain vast rewards of virtue.

source_sentence: 種族名號聲聞眾，　　悉如今日釋迦尊；
translation: Their clans, named śrāvakas, are all now the honored Śākyamunis of the present day.

source_sentence: 善能調伏有情類，　　遠離眾苦歸圓寂。』
translation: He's well able to tame sentient beings and types, parting with all suffering and returning to perfect quiescence.'

source_sentence: 爾時陶師長跪發願，說伽他曰：「其陶輪子亦發是言：『願我當來如佛侍者。』」
translation: It was then that the potter knelt down long enough to make a vow and said, The potter's disciple also made this request, 'May I come back in the future as the Buddha's attendant.'

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我於爾時，初施釋迦如來，得證無上菩提。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, At the time, I first gave it to the Śākyamuni Tathāgata and realized unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 其子者，即阿難陀是。」
translation: That son is Ānanda.

source_sentence: 王復問世尊曰：「從初乃至成佛，供養幾許諸佛，而證無上菩提？」
translation: Again, the king asked the Bhagavān, How many buddhas did you make offerings to those from the beginning until you became a buddha and then realize unsurpassed enlightenment?

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我從釋迦如來最初阿僧企耶，乃至護世佛時，以清淨心，如是供養七萬五千佛，於爾許時供養不曾心異，唯求無上正等菩提。
translation: The Buddha told the great king, From the time of the first incalculable eon of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, up to the time of World-protecting Buddha, I made offerings to 75,000 buddhas like this with a pure mind at the time and didn't change my mind; I simply sought unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 第二僧企耶，我初供養燃燈佛，乃至寶髻佛，以清淨心，如是供養七萬六千佛。
translation: In the second saṃgha, I first offered offerings to the Buddha of the Burning Lamp and even to the Buddha of the Jewel-topknot Bodhisattva, thus making offerings to 70,000 or 60,000 buddhas with a pure mind.

source_sentence: 我雖經歷多生，心無有異，常以清信供養諸佛。
translation: Although I've gone through many births, my mind hasn't changed, and I always make offerings to the buddhas with pure faith.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 第三阿僧企耶，初供養寶髻佛，乃至安隱佛。
translation: The third incalculable eon is the first offering to the jeweled-topknot Buddha and up to the peaceful Buddha.

source_sentence: 如是供養七萬七千佛，如是又至迦攝波佛。
translation: He thus made offerings to 70,000 buddhas and thus went to Kāśyapa Buddha.

source_sentence: 我雖供養無有異心，常以淨信供養諸佛。
translation: Although I make offerings with no different mind, I always offer my pure faith to the buddhas.

source_sentence: 為菩薩時如是供養，皆蒙諸佛為我受記，當證無上正等菩提。
translation: When they make such offerings for the bodhisattvas, they'll all receive assurance from the buddhas that they'll attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 滿我所願，思求正覺，堅固釋持，慈攝一切有情故。」
translation: Fulfilling my wishes, I'll contemplate right awakening, resolutely explain and maintain it, and compassionately taking care of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 爾時勝光王聞佛說已，心大歡喜，頂禮雙足，奉辭而去。
translation: Having heard the Buddha’s exhortation, King Prabhākaramitra was greatly delighted. After bowing his head at [the Buddha’s] feet, he took his leave and departed.

source_sentence: 「唯願世間尊，　　為我分別說；
translation: “All I ask, World-Honored One, is that you explain this distinctly for me.

source_sentence: 何處初發意？　　為求大菩提。
translation: Where did you first set out for enlightenment in order to seek great awakening?

source_sentence: 更願無上士，　　為說本事緣，
translation: I entreat you, O supreme being, to tell me the story of my past lives.

source_sentence: 曾供養幾佛？　　復經幾許時？」
translation: How many buddhas did you formerly worship and how long does it take to do so?

source_sentence: 「無上兩足尊，　　慈愍有情者；
translation: The supreme two-legged honored one is Compassionate to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 於彼發菩提，　　誓度三有海。
translation: They give rise to enlightenment there, vowing to save the ocean of the three existences.

source_sentence: 聞佛心離欲，　　廣說醉象緣；
translation: Hearing that the Buddha’s mind is free from desire, They explain in detail the conditions for drunkenness.

source_sentence: 厭離貪欲習，　　因發菩提心。
translation: Being disillusioned with the habit of craving, they give rise to the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 堅固發誓願，　　惠施如河沙；
translation: Firmly undertaking the vow of enlightenment, They bestow blessings like rivers and sand.

source_sentence: 光明王世時，　　專求正覺等。
translation: When the king of light was in the world, he focused on seeking right awakening and so forth.

source_sentence: 初見釋迦佛，　　我作陶輪師；
translation: When I first saw the buddha Śākyamuni Buddha, I became his potter.

source_sentence: 酥油蜜漿等，　　最初為供養。
translation: The first is the offering of butter, oil, honey, juice, and so on.

source_sentence: 亦曾為上女，　　正信三寶尊；
translation: I also once was a supreme woman Who correctly believed in the Three Jewels.

source_sentence: 我見憍陳佛，　　以燈油奉施。
translation: When I saw Kauṇḍinya Buddha, I offered him a gift of lamp oil.

source_sentence: 無勝佛世時，　　我曾作三藏；
translation: At the time of the nonsurpassing buddha world, I once composed three collections.

source_sentence: 共大眾相競，　　惡罵僧為女。
translation: They're in competition with the masses, abusing the saṃgha as a woman.

source_sentence: 由斯口惡業，　　變我身為女；
translation: As a result of these verbal evil deeds, I am transformed into a woman.

source_sentence: 却迴心淨已，　　還變為丈夫。
translation: He turns away, purifies his mind, and returns to become a husband.

source_sentence: 乃往過去世，　　曾為王子時；
translation: In a past life I was once a prince.

source_sentence: 寶髻佛兄弟，　　我以燈明施。
translation: Jewel-topknot Buddha's brothers, I gave them my lamp as a gift.

source_sentence: 三月曾供養，　　安隱佛世尊；
translation: In the past three months I offered offerings to the World-honored One Anāthapiṇḍika Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛滅度之後，　　以舍利起塔。
translation: After the parinirvāṇa of the Buddha, he built a stūpa with his relics.

source_sentence: 曾作富長者，　　三月供養佛；
translation: Formerly I served as a wealthy householder, honoring the Buddha with offerings for three months.

source_sentence: 世尊滅度後，　　建塔九十肘。
translation: After the parinirvāṇa of the World-honored One, A stupa for ninety yojanas will be built.

source_sentence: 後見有勝佛，　　梵志中為最；
translation: The latter is the best among brahmins in terms of having a superior buddha.

source_sentence: 舉手合掌敬，　　供養人中尊。
translation: He raised his hand and joined his palms in reverence, honoring the most venerable among men.

source_sentence: 昔時作梵志，　　書論悉明解；
translation: Formerly I was a brāhmaṇa, Understanding all books and treatises.

source_sentence: 我逢利益佛，　　施座奉如來。
translation: When I met a buddha of benefit, I offered my seat to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 往修苦行時，　　曾住仙人法；
translation: Formerly, when he practiced austerities, He lived in the way of a holy man.

source_sentence: 見憍陳世尊，　　捉身欲山下。
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān Kauṇḍinya, he grabbed his body and wanted to go down the mountain.

source_sentence: 我曾作仙人，　　遇逢樂見佛；
translation: I was once a sage, meeting buddhas and seeing them with joy.

source_sentence: 諸佛至居處，　　以根菓供養。
translation: The buddhas came to their dwelling places And offered them roots and fruit.

source_sentence: 往昔作仙人，　　見善眼世尊；
translation: In the past I was a sage, Seeing the World-honored One Sunetra.

source_sentence: 以著樹皮衣，　　持施覆其身。
translation: He puts on a tree bark robe and carries it to cover his body.

source_sentence: 昔曾作人王，　　供養勒叉佛；
translation: Formerly I served as a human king And honored the buddha Lokeṣa.

source_sentence: 頓捨四兵眾，　　求無上菩提。
translation: He suddenly abandons the four armies of soldiers and seeks unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 從初釋迦佛，　　至於護世佛；
translation: From the first buddha Śākyamuni Buddha Up to the World-protecting Buddha.

source_sentence: 七萬五千佛，　　我皆盡供養。
translation: Seventy-five thousand buddhas, I will give them all as offerings.

source_sentence: 此是一僧祇，　　如是行供養；
translation: This is one incalculable eon, And they make offerings like this.

source_sentence: 一心無異別，　　恒發菩提願。
translation: With one mind without distinction, they always make the vow of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 次見燃燈佛，　　多聞甚可愛；
translation: Next, he saw the buddha Candraprabha, Most learned and most desirable.

source_sentence: 以七青蓮花，　　作梵志持供。
translation: With seven blue lotus flowers, he makes an offering to the priest who carries them.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　見佛名有相；
translation: Formerly I was a king, Seeing the Buddha’s name as having marks.

source_sentence: 於佛修行處，　　供養此如來。
translation: At the place where the Buddha practiced, he offered support to this Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名住修；
translation: I was once the king of a kingdom. There is a buddha named Abiding in Meditation.

source_sentence: 以妙色珍寶，　　音聲而供養。
translation: With beautiful colors and precious treasures, he makes offerings with his voice.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　佛號超師子；
translation: I was once the king of a kingdom, The Buddha’s name being transfigured like a lion.

source_sentence: 我以寶幡蓋，　　供養此如來。
translation: I'll offer a jeweled banner and canopy to this Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　佛名安隱日；
translation: I was once the king of a kingdom. The Buddha’s name was peaceful day.

source_sentence: 王有一千城，　　皆令修供養。
translation: The king has a thousand cities, All of which he orders to make offerings.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名梵志；
translation: I was once the king of a kingdom. There was a buddha named Brahmakāyika (i.e., Indra).

source_sentence: 以浴室香湯，　　依時沐浴佛。
translation: He uses the fragrant bathing water of the bathhouse to bathe the Buddha as he pleases.

source_sentence: 我昔作國王，　　城中而供養；
translation: In the past I served as a king and offered offerings in the city.

source_sentence: 三千梵志佛，　　及一尸棄佛。
translation: Three thousand brahmin buddhas and one śikhin buddha.

source_sentence: 我曾作長者，　　於財增城中；
translation: I was once a wealthy man In the city of Vaiśeṣika.

source_sentence: 供二十五佛，　　修行於梵行。
translation: They will make offerings to twenty-five buddhas And practice the holy life.

source_sentence: 我曾作長者，　　於彼大城中；
translation: I was once the wealthy man In that great city.

source_sentence: 供養尸棄佛，　　建立寺舍塔。
translation: Making offerings to Śikhin Buddha, they built temples and stūpas.

source_sentence: 其寺供七佛，　　奉施珍寶具；
translation: The monasteries offered to the seven buddhas And presented gifts of rare treasures and implements.

source_sentence: 及以奴婢等，　　莊宅花園林。
translation: And with slaves and maidservants, they adorned their homes, gardens, and forests.

source_sentence: 曾作王信敬，　　於尸棄佛所；
translation: Formerly I served as a king and worshiped the Buddha at Śikhin.

source_sentence: 復在彼城中，　　唯求正等覺。
translation: They're also in that city, seeking only perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 昔曾作梵志，　　有佛名歡喜；
translation: In the past I was once a brahmin. There is a buddha named Rejoicing.

source_sentence: 為求菩提故，　　以果先供養。
translation: In order to seek enlightenment, they first make offerings with fruit.

source_sentence: 曾作長者時，　　有佛名善眼；
translation: When you were once a wealthy man, There was a buddha named Sunetra.

source_sentence: 我以摩尼寶，　　供養此如來。
translation: I'll offer this maṇi treasure to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 亦曾作商主，　　有佛名善生；
translation: I also once served as a merchant lord. There was a buddha named Sudarśana.

source_sentence: 坐於菩提樹，　　以餅先供養。
translation: Sitting at the tree of enlightenment, he first offered cakes as an offering.

source_sentence: 於千商人中，　　曾作千商主；
translation: Among the one thousand merchants, He was once the leader of a thousand merchants.

source_sentence: 見佛坐菩提，　　號名善意佛。
translation: Seeing the Buddha sitting in enlightenment, he's called the Buddha of good intentions.

source_sentence: 香泥塗佛上，　　復以扇招涼；
translation: Putting scented mud on the Buddha’s feet, He also invited coolness by means of a fan.

source_sentence: 佛邊坐聽法，　　聞法心開悟。
translation: Sitting near the Buddha and listening to the Dharma, hearing the Dharma, their minds are enlightened.

source_sentence: 昔作商人主，　　有佛名釋迦；
translation: Formerly, as a merchant lord, There was a buddha named Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 我以眾寶花，　　以花散佛上。
translation: I'll scatter flowers of myriad treasures on top of the Buddha with flowers.

source_sentence: 昔作商人主，　　有佛名高登；
translation: In the past I served as a merchant lord, And there was a buddha named Kukkuṭavyūha.

source_sentence: 以幡花音樂，　　供養如是佛。
translation: With banners, flowers, and music They honor such buddhas.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名最上；
translation: I was once the king of a kingdom. There is a buddha named Supreme, Whose name is Vairocana.

source_sentence: 超越諸有海，　　當施眾車輅。
translation: Beyond the ocean of existence, you'll give chariots and carts to all people.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名最尊；
translation: I was once the king of a kingdom. There is a buddha named Supreme Honorable One.

source_sentence: 佛行百里內，　　地散諸妙花。
translation: Within a hundred li from the place where the Buddha was walking, Exquisite flowers were scattered on the ground.

source_sentence: 我於過去世，　　聞佛欲來過；
translation: In a past life, I heard that the Buddha wanted to come.

source_sentence: 遠將勝幡蓋，　　并四兵圍遶。
translation: Vaiśravaṇa was surrounded by banners, canopies, and four armies from a distance.

source_sentence: 有佛欲渡河，　　我當作舡師；
translation: If there is a buddha who wishes to cross the river, I will be his raft master.

source_sentence: 見佛心歡喜，　　渡佛到彼岸。
translation: Rejoicing at the sight of the Buddha, they crossed over to the other shore.

source_sentence: 我曾作商主，　　有佛名賢車；
translation: In the past I was a merchant lord. There was a buddha named Bhadrakavyūha (i.e., “wheel of virtue”).

source_sentence: 為佛造橋梁，　　令佛安隱渡。
translation: He built a bridge for the Buddha And caused him to cross it safely.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名大梵；
translation: Formerly I was the king of a kingdom. There was a buddha named Mahābrahmā.

source_sentence: 牛頭香造寺，　　以供養於尊。
translation: An ox-headed incense monastery was built to honor the venerable.

source_sentence: 著僧伽胝衣，　　以覆如來上；
translation: He wore the saṃghâvaśeṣa robe To cover the top of the Buddha’s head.

source_sentence: 儉世檀香浴，　　降雨人歸佛。
translation: In the world of frugality, he bathes in sandalwood and sends rain to return people to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名淨月；
translation: I was once the king of a country. There was a buddha named Jingmue (i.e., Pure Moon).

source_sentence: 國有多疾疫，　　供佛疫皆除。
translation: The country has many epidemics of illness, and the epidemic of offerings to the Buddha will all be removed.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　有佛名調帝；
translation: Formerly, when I was a king, There was a buddha named Sadāparibhūta.

source_sentence: 請佛說妙法，　　為求菩提道。
translation: He asks the Buddha to teach the wonderful Dharma In order to seek the path of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　有佛名梵尊；
translation: Formerly, when I was a king, There was a buddha named Brahmakāyika.

source_sentence: 施佛僧伽胝，　　用覆如來上。
translation: Giving to the Buddha's saṃghâva, he uses it to cover the Tathāgata's head.

source_sentence: 當時國中儉，　　我以旃檀湯；
translation: The kingdoms of the country at that time were frugal, and I offered sandalwood soup to them.

source_sentence: 沐浴如來體，　　豐樂人歸佛。
translation: He bathes the body of the Tathāgata, and his abundant happiness returns to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　有佛名帝釋；
translation: Formerly, when I was a king, There was a buddha named Indra.

source_sentence: 其國有災起，　　王發慈止息。
translation: When a disaster occurred in that country, the king became compassionate and stopped.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　供養調帝佛；
translation: Formerly, when I was a king, I made offerings to the Buddha Sadāparibhūta.

source_sentence: 用諸百萬寶，　　造食獻如來。
translation: With millions of myriads of treasures, I prepared food for the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志信，　　見佛名悉達；
translation: In the past I was a religious believer, Seeing the Buddha’s name as Siddhārtha.

source_sentence: 以百千頌讚，　　供養天人師。
translation: With hundreds of thousands of verses praising him, he offered support to the teacher of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志時，　　佛名帝釋幢；
translation: Formerly, when he was a brahman, The Buddha’s name was Indra Banner.

source_sentence: 合掌以正信，　　當來願如佛。
translation: He joins his palms with right faith, vowing to be like the Buddha in the future.

source_sentence: 始從燃燈佛，　　至於帝釋幢；
translation: From the Buddha Dīpaṅkara Up to Indra’s Banner.

source_sentence: 七萬六千佛，　　我皆盡供養。
translation: Seventy-six thousand buddhas I will give them all as offerings.

source_sentence: 滿二阿僧祇，　　供養於諸佛；
translation: To fulfill two incalculable eons, They honored the Buddhas.

source_sentence: 不曾心有異，　　志願菩提處。
translation: Never has there been a dissimilar mind that wishes for the abode of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 第三阿僧祇，　　亦為王供養；
translation: In the third incalculable eon They are also offered to the kings.

source_sentence: 佛名安隱日，　　滅度而起塔。
translation: The Buddha’s name was peaceful; On the day of his nirvana a stupa was built.

source_sentence: 我昔為國王，　　種種供養佛；
translation: Formerly I was the king of my country, Making various offerings to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 滿足皆隨意，　　起塔名法王。
translation: Fulfilling them all at will, he builds a stūpa named King of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 昔為大商主，　　見佛名悉供；
translation: Formerly he was a great merchant lord, Seeing the Buddha’s name and making offerings to all.

source_sentence: 我以眾金花，　　散佛呈供養。
translation: I scattered many golden flowers And offered them to the Buddha as an offering.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名寶髻；
translation: Formerly, when I was a merchant, I saw buddhas called Jewel Topknot.

source_sentence: 為佛作金網，　　以覆大師上。
translation: I'll make a gold net for the Buddha to cover the great teacher.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　佛名上蓮花；
translation: Formerly, when he was a merchant, The Buddha’s name was Supreme Lotus.

source_sentence: 作銀花供養，　　散布如來上。
translation: Making offerings of silver flowers, they spread them over the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名上稱；
translation: Formerly, when I was a merchant, I saw the buddha’s name and renounced it.

source_sentence: 我以上妙室，　　供養於如來。
translation: I'll go up to the marvelous room above to make offerings to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　佛號名勝論；
translation: Formerly he was the king of a great empire, The Buddha’s name being Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 正證菩提日，　　我以四兵護。
translation: On the day he realizes enlightenment, I'll protect him with four armies.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名無垢；
translation: Formerly, when I was a merchant, I saw the Buddha’s name as Immaculate.

source_sentence: 造塔并浴室，　　及以燃燈明。
translation: He built a stūpa, a bathhouse, and a lamp to burn the light.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　見佛名合覺；
translation: When I was a king in the past, I saw buddhas called harmonious enlightenment.

source_sentence: 坐石而入定，　　音樂以供養。
translation: He sat on the rock and entered meditation, making offerings with music.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名修行；
translation: Formerly, when I was a merchant, I saw the Buddha’s name and practiced.

source_sentence: 降怨度人眾，　　掃地令佛過。
translation: He subdues enemies and liberates people, sweeps the ground and causes the Buddha to transgress.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　聞佛名淨住；
translation: Formerly, when I was a merchant, I heard the Buddha’s name and stayed pure.

source_sentence: 欲來造寺舍，　　園苑毘訶羅。
translation: I want to build a monastery in the park, Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　有佛名相師；
translation: Formerly I was the king of a great kingdom. There was a buddha named physiognomist.

source_sentence: 摩尼寶供養，　　我時為菩薩。
translation: At the time, I was a bodhisattva who made offerings of jewels.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　有佛名繫都；
translation: Formerly, as the king of a great country, There was a buddha named Tejaprabhū.

source_sentence: 我造法王塔，　　繒幡以供養。
translation: I'll build a stūpa for the king of the Dharma and offer it to him with streamers and banners.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　有佛名捨重；
translation: Formerly I was the king of a great kingdom. There was a buddha named Abandoning Wealth.

source_sentence: 我以瓶杖施，　　起塔并設會。
translation: I'll give it to you with a pot and stick, build a stūpa, and set up an assembly.

source_sentence: 我昔為商主，　　有佛名見義；
translation: In the past I was a merchant lord. There was a buddha named Vaiśravaṇa (i.e., Vimalakīrti).

source_sentence: 以金寶真珠，　　種種香供養。
translation: They offer various kinds of incense and offerings, made of gold, jewels, real beads, and pearls.

source_sentence: 我為大國王，　　佛名諸兵義；
translation: I am the king of a great kingdom. The Buddha is called military commander.

source_sentence: 佛遊於人間，　　四兵迎供養。
translation: When the Buddha traveled among the people, Four armies of soldiers greeted him and offered support.

source_sentence: 我為大國王，　　佛名他利見；
translation: I am the king of a great kingdom. The Buddha is called Paranirmitavaśavartin.

source_sentence: 欲入於城內，　　設樂香花供。
translation: They want to enter the city and offer music, incense, flowers, and offerings.

source_sentence: 我昔為商主，　　有佛名底沙；
translation: Formerly, as a merchant lord, I had a buddha named Tiṣya.

source_sentence: 以諸莖木香，　　根香散供佛。
translation: Scattering the fragrance of their stems and wood, And the fragrance of their roots, Is offered to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「我昔曾為大仙人，　　見晨宿佛在寶龕；
translation: Formerly I was once a great sage, Seeing the Buddha in the jeweled niche In the morning and night.

source_sentence: 但一伽他而讚佛，　　超過九劫修苦行。
translation: He simply praised the Buddha for one verse and cultivated austerities for more than nine eons.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志名最上，　　見佛名曰毘婆尸；
translation: Formerly he was a brahman called the Supreme, Whose name was Vipaśyin when he saw the Buddha.

source_sentence: 兩手持苣發菩提，　　歡喜布散如來上。
translation: Enlightenment arises from holding the herbs in both hands, and joy spreads out on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 菩薩昔為商主時，　　見佛世尊名尸棄；
translation: When the enlightening being was a merchant in the past, He saw the Buddha, the World-honored One, Whose name was Śikhin.

source_sentence: 并有弟子聲聞眾，　　三月衣食而供給。
translation: There were also disciples and śrāvakas, who offered food and clothing for three months.

source_sentence: 昔為商人深正信，　　於彼毘婆尸佛所；
translation: Formerly, as a merchant with deep faith, I was staying at Vipaśyin Buddha’s place.

source_sentence: 并諸弟子聲聞眾，　　三月衣食而供給。
translation: He was accompanied by the disciples and śrāvakas, who provided food and clothing for three months.

source_sentence: 昔為商人深正信，　　佛名迦留村陀佛；
translation: Formerly, as a merchant with deep faith, The Buddha was named Krakucchanda Buddha.

source_sentence: 請佛家資盡布施，　　隨佛出家持梵行。
translation: Requesting the Buddha's family to provide for all of his donations, he leaves home and maintains the religious practice according to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 昔為商人深正信，　　見佛迦耶迦牟尼；
translation: In the past I was a merchant, deeply and correctly believing, Seeing the Buddha Kasyapa Sage.

source_sentence: 先造立寺生恭敬，　　後乃方隨佛出家。
translation: He first built a temple and paid respect to it, and then left home after following the Buddha.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志名最勝，　　於兩足尊迦葉佛；
translation: Formerly he was a brahman called the Supreme One, Renownable among two-legged buddhas: Kāśyapa Buddha.

source_sentence: 由聞喜護所說語，　　乃得出家修淨意。
translation: By hearing the words spoken by joyful protectors, they'll leave home and cultivate pure intentions.

source_sentence: 菩薩昔作國王時，　　於彌勒仙修供養；
translation: Formerly, when the enlightening beings were kings, They made offerings to Maitreya.

source_sentence: 入定見我當作佛，　　時仙却來供養我。
translation: Seeing me in meditation as a buddha, the sage then came to make offerings to me.

source_sentence: 從安隱佛至迦葉，　　供養七萬七千佛；
translation: From Anyin Buddha to Kāśyapa, they honored seventy-seven thousand buddhas.

source_sentence: 一切如來皆奉侍，　　乃能數滿三僧祇。
translation: All the enlightened ones served them, And they were able to number more than three incalculable numbers.

source_sentence: 皆悉歡喜而供事，　　未曾少許心別異；
translation: They all rejoice and serve, Yet never with dissimilar minds.

source_sentence: 皆發無上菩提願，　　為菩薩時供養佛。
translation: They all give rise to the supreme vow of enlightenment and make offerings to the Buddha when they're bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 一切示現而授記，　　對眾咸言當作佛；
translation: They manifest all and give assurances of enlightenment, Telling the masses to become buddhas.

source_sentence: 我先求願皆滿足，　　如先所願今思忖。
translation: I first fulfilled all my wishes, just as I had previously vowed, and now I'm thinking about it.

source_sentence: 此願皆令得滿足，　　彼佛世尊諸大德；
translation: Let these vows all be fulfilled, The great virtues of those buddhas and world-honored ones.

source_sentence: 授我無上菩提記。　　我昔曾作尸毘王，
translation: Give me the assurance of highest enlightenment.’ In the past I was once the king Śrīvardhana,

source_sentence: 復為一切施主時，　　并及尾濫大王身，
translation: Furthermore, when he's a donor to all the donors, his tail wrapped around the king's body,

source_sentence: 捨身捨寶行檀度。　　昔為商主入大海，
translation: Formerly, as a merchant lord, he entered the great sea of Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 持戒專求趣彼岸，　　能害自身令眾樂，
translation: Observing precepts, they exclusively seek to reach the other shore, Able to harm themselves and bring happiness to others.

source_sentence: 皆令得度於苦海。　　往昔曾作仙人時，
translation: They will all attain liberation from the sea of suffering.” In the past he was once a holy man.

source_sentence: 常行忍辱波羅蜜，　　身體手足被支解，
translation: He always practiced the transcendent of forbearance, His body, hands, feet, and limbs being untied.

source_sentence: 由行忍辱心無退，　　如緊那羅本生說。
translation: By practicing forbearance, the mind never regresses, as explained in the kiṃnara-sūtra.

source_sentence: 我曾欲竭於大海，　　以滿精進波羅蜜，
translation: I once wished to dry up the ocean And fill it with the transcendent energy.

source_sentence: 皆由口業真實語。　　昔名藥物大臣時，
translation: It is all due to the genuine speech of verbal action.

source_sentence: 牛出梵志共論義，　　當滿般若波羅蜜，
translation: Ox-leading priests who discuss the meaning together will fulfill the perfection of prajñāpāramitā,

source_sentence: 諸天擊鼓而助喜。　　昔為梵志名生然，
translation: The gods beat their drums to help rejoice, and in olden times they were brahmans called Śubhavyūha.

source_sentence: 勤修勝禪波羅蜜，　　頭上鳥生男女卵，
translation: They diligently cultivate the transcendent meditation of superior enlightenment, And birds on their heads give birth to male and female eggs.

source_sentence: 定中不起鳥能飛。　　修行滿六波羅蜜，
translation: In the state of absorption no bird can fly, and he cultivates all six transcendent ways.

source_sentence: 慈心常有思念處，　　我廣心求尊重願，
translation: The mind of kindness always has a place for reflection, And my mind widely seeks honor and respect.

source_sentence: 發願願求皆滿足。　　彼諸大德一切佛，
translation: Their vows and aspirations are all fulfilled.

source_sentence: 我皆供養天人師，　　三有苦海諸眾生，
translation: I honor the teacher of gods, humans, and all sentient beings in the three oceans of suffering.

source_sentence: 一切皆歸涅槃路，　　我為菩薩修供養。
translation: They all return to the path of nirvāṇa, And I cultivate offerings for enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 從彼光明王身後，　　乃至帝幢佛世尊；
translation: From the body of that king of light, Up to the world-honored one Indra’s Banner Buddha:

source_sentence: 度得一千俱胝眾，　　況復成佛度無邊。
translation: He liberates a thousand corpuscles of people, so why wouldn't he become a buddha and save limitlessly?

source_sentence: 世間之尊大導師，　　已度未度人天眾；
translation: The Honored Guide of the World, the Great Guide, Has liberated beings and gods who have not yet liberated.

source_sentence: 我已置立橋船筏，　　堅固度於諸有情。
translation: I've set up a bridge, boat, raft, and firmly delivered sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我若入於圓寂後，　　由能濟度無邊人，
translation: If I enter after the perfect nirvana, Because I can save and liberate boundless beings.

source_sentence: 諸有能修福德者，　　當來皆入涅槃城。
translation: Those who can cultivate virtue will all enter the city of nirvāṇa in the future.

source_sentence: 我若入於圓寂後，　　而能修集於佛事，
translation: If I were to enter after perfect nirvana And cultivate the works of buddhas,

source_sentence: 少許供養於形像，　　即得生天無量樂。
translation: Making a small offering to the image, he'll be born in heaven with measureless happiness.

source_sentence: 我若入於圓寂後，　　遺留法寶甘露味，
translation: If I enter after the perfect nirvana And leave behind the ambrosia of my dharma treasure,

source_sentence: 如若有情聞此者，　　皆能修習出離去。」
translation: If there are sentient beings who hear this, they'll all be able to cultivate escape.

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀即以伽陀，請世尊曰：爾時世尊以頌答曰：　已上諸佛名。
translation: Ānanda of Kauśinagara then asked the Bhagavān with a verse, At that point, the Bhagavān answered in verse, The names of the buddhas are as above.
